abstract: Chipotle Mexican Grill announces federal prosecutors have expanded investigation into multistate food-borne illness outbreaks and warns investigation will continue to affect sales that dropped significantly at end of 2015; reports quarterly profits dropped 44 percent, to $67.9 million, down from $121.2 million in year-earlier period.
lead_paragraph: The company said its profits fell 44 percent in the fourth quarter after outbreaks of food-borne illnesses linked to its restaurants in several states.

headline.main: Chipotle Food-Safety Issues Drag Down Profits
headline.print_headline: As U.S. Inquiry Into Food-Borne Illness Widens, Chipotle Reports a Plunge in Profits

snippet: The company said its profits fell 44 percent in the fourth quarter after outbreaks of food-borne illnesses linked to its restaurants in several states.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
